headline: AI Is Slamming the Advertising Business. This Company’s Earnings Are Another Warning.
summary: WPP  became the latest casualty of artificial intelligence’s assault on the advertising industry.  WPP  is a London-based advertising giant with clients like  Wendy’s Unilever  and  Ford Motor  That doesn’t make it immune to broader industry changes.  American depositary receipts of WPP sank 18% on Wednesday after the company provided disappointing financial guidance as clients pull back spending.

American depositary receipts of WPP sank 18% on Wednesday after the company provided disappointing financial guidance as clients pull back spending.

headline: Summer Travel Meets Safety Concerns as U.S. Vehicle Recalls Reach Highest Level in Over a Year
summary: As summer road trips ramp up across the country, a sharp rise in U.S. vehicle recalls is triggering new concerns for drivers and dealerships alike. According to BizzyCar's Q2 2025 Recall Report, more than 7.3 million vehicles were recalled between April and June. This marks the highest quarterly total in over a year and more than double the volume reported in Q1.

headline: Automakers push EV sales as $7,500 US tax credit is set to end
summary: DETROIT (Reuters) -Automakers are urging customers to snap up electric vehicles before a $7,500 U.S. tax credit goes away this fall.  The same day, Ford Motor extended its deal for free home chargers and installation through the end of September to entice EV shoppers.  Sweeping tax and budget legislation approved by Congress will eliminate $7,500 tax credits for buying or leasing new electric vehicles and a $4,000 used-EV credit at the end of September.
